move.generic script - Ships will recalculate when the object they are moving to an object and it changes sectors.
move.generic script - Ships will be forced to use travel drive in some instances they would slowboat instead.
move.generic script - Ships will attempt to get closer to their destination point instead of within 10km of it. (Unless they are really really big)
engineer.ai script - Objects that can repair themselves are no longer skill limited and will repair to 100%, eventually.
engineer.ai script - Objects that can repair themselves will keep the drones internal and calculations are adjusted for total number of repair drones, not drones that have been launched.
interrupt.attacked script - Adjusts flee calculations. Civilian ships will flee when they are reduced to less than 150% of hull percentage + shield percentage.

interrupt.attacked script - Military ships will be allowed to flee if they are reduced to below than 75% of hull percentage + shield percentage. If the ship has an attack order, it will not flee if it thinks it can destroy it's target before dying.
interrupt.attacked script - Adjusts retaliation calculations. Stops xenon economy ships from always fighting.
interrupt.attacked script - Civilian ships will be allowed to retaliate if they are currently waiting for orders and they think they can destroy their target before dying.
interrupt.attacked script - Ships will not call for help if the police have a better relationship with the attacker.
interrupt.attacked script - Changes HP percentage of {1111920,5031}.
interrupt.attacked script - Changes HP percentage of {1111920,5032}.
lib.calculate.miningefficiency script - A resource probe anywhere in the sector will provide benefits.
lib.respond.inspected script - Ships without a set response to being inspected will comply when they have nothing to fear from police.
move.collect.ship.smallship script - Small ships collecting drops will use their travel drive more for objects further than 5km away.
move.collect.ship.smallship script - Small ships collecting drops will use an instant container magnet for wares within 5km.
move.seekenemies script - Police will respond more reliably to trouble calls in their sector. This also implements support for ships mimic'ing the police order.

move.seekenemies script - Police and patrols will respond more reliably to distress calls in their sector (Yes, patrol ships will actually respond unlike vanilla). This also implements support for ships mimic'ing the patrol/police order.
move.seekenemies script - Removes the skill check for ships responding to trouble or distress calls further than their radar coverage.
order.build.deploy script - Sets up payment scale for player owned building ships. Ships earn 1,000,000 Cr per hour of work with a minimum of 500,000 Cr.
order.build.deploy script - Fixes bug where ships that move to new task after waiting more than an hour for resources at build storage leave their drones behind.
order.build.find.task script - Allows player owned building ships to be hired by NPC factions and will respect travel/activity blacklists.
order.mining.routine script - Removes the tripling of maxrange applied to player owned ships with 5 star pilot.
order.mining.routine script - Ships that are set to order multiple wares will always check for demand to determine which ware to gather.
order.mining.routine script - Ships that check demand will check stations that they would actually be able to sell at.
order.mining.routine script - Player owned ships that have unsellable cargo due to lack of demand will drop the wares just like the NPC mining ships do.
order.move.recon script - Police ships that are scanning law abiding ships can do so from a longer range.
order.move.recon script - Police ships that are moving to scan a ship will attempt to move to where the target is going instead of just constantly moving to where the ship was when the move started.
order.move.recon script - Police ships will complete scans much faster than vanilla.
order.move.recon script - Should prevent/reduce police going hostile for seemingly no reason.
trade.find.free script - Filters sell offers from stations the ship would actually be able to buy from.
trade.find.free script - Filters buy offers from stations the ship would actually be able to sell to.

trade.find.free script - Adjusts the NPC ship filtering so that it actually works but restricts the trades to small and medium ships. This also fixes a bug where player ships would ignore the minimum volume so you shouldn't see large ships with 27 energy cells.

trade.station script - Stops stations from ignoring reservations for wares that it wants to send to it's build storage. This fixes a lot of failed trades where the ship arrives to a station that no longer has the wares for it.

trade.station script - Stops stations from breaking trades with the extremely slow and buggy calculations/methods used to transfer wares to it's build storage. If a station has the wares at the interval, it will actually send wares to build storage.
